page.title: 02EMPLOYMENT IN FELMINGHAM
page.content: Mainly an agricultural area, the village of Felmingham spreads over the B1145 road from North Walsham to Aylsham. The surrounding area is mainly arable farming; both large land owners and smallholders. There are small industrial companies, light engineering and contract cleaners. several crafts exist including a pottery. The popolation is drawn from all over the country; about half being locally born, the rest moving into the village to work at the Oil and Gas Sites at Bacton or at RAF Coltishall; or to retire to the country from London or the Midlands. There is very little unemployment in the area, although it is necessary to travel to North Walsham or Norwich for work.
